work.name: OceanOS
work.summary: Developing DARWIN, a marine foundation model using geospatial data for oceanic intelligence and conservation. Responsibilities included building pretraining datasets (NetCDF, Zarr), designing the 3D spatiotemporal model, implementing a multi-GPU PyTorch Lightning pipeline, Dockerizing workflows, managing cloud infrastructure (AWS/DO), and optimizing the training process (achieving 70x speedup).

education.area: Natural and Social Sciences - Specialization Artificial Intelligence

publications.name: Reproducing NevIR: Negation in Neural Information Retrieval
publications.summary: Reproduced and extended the NevIR benchmark, confirming that negation remains challenging for neural IR models. While newer LLM re-rankers show improvement, their understanding of negation doesn't fully generalize across different datasets (NevIR and ExcluIR).

projects.name: Geometric Algebra Simplicial Transformer
highlights: Project for the masters course Deep Learning 2
The project aims to develop a new class of equivariant transformers by leveraging simplicial complexes and Clifford algebra to achieve equivariance to the full symmetry group.

projects.name: Predicting Perceived Attributes of Urban Images using Low-dimensional Holistic Image Representations
highlights: In this study, research is done into to what extent can GIST features be used to cluster Amsterdam's street scenes in a manner that captures their perceived attributes.

projects.name: Robustness against Label Noise in Road Defect Severity Estimation
highlights: Project for the bachelor course Learning and deciding
This study researches the challenges of using CNN's for automating road defect severity estimation: combining severity estimation with road defect classification and robustness to label noise.
